detaileddescription.para: Applications typically organize sets of their parameters into logical units called tables. These are typically constant parameters that can change the behavior of a flight software algorithm and are only intended to be modified by operations personnel. Examples of this would be attitude control gains, sensor scalefactors, telemetry filter settings, etc. None of the cFE core applications (EVS, SB, ES, TIME or TBL) use tables.

Table Services (TBL) provides a centralized control of flight software tables. Operations personnel would interact with TBL in order to dump the contents of current tables, load new table images, verify the contents of a table image and manage Critical tables.
For additional detail on Tables and how to manage them, see the following sections:

para.ref: How To Remove cFE Table Services
